title: History of Music
text: It is often debated to what extent the origins of music will ever be understood,
and there are competing theories that aim to explain it.
Many scholars highlight a relationship between the origin of music and the
, and there is disagreement surrounding whether music developed before, after, or simultaneously with language.
A similar source of contention surrounds whether music was the intentional result of
or was a byproduct
of evolution.
The earliest influential theory was proposed by
in 1871, who stated that music arose as a form of
, perhaps via mating calls.
Darwin's original perspective has been heavily criticized for its inconsistencies with other sexual selection methods,
though many scholars in the 21st century have developed and promoted the theory.
Other theories include that music arose to assist in organizing labor, improving long-distance communication, benefiting communication with the
, assisting in community cohesion or as a defense to scare off predators.
can only be theorized based on findings from
archaeology sites. The disputed
, a perforated
, is at least 40,000 years old, though there is considerable debate surrounding whether it is truly a
or an object formed by animals.
The earliest objects whose designations as musical instruments are widely accepted are
from the
, Germany, namely from the
and
caves.
Dated to the
(of the Upper Paleolithic) and used by
, from all three caves there are eight examples, four made from the
of birds and four from
; three of these are near complete.
Three flutes from the Geissenklösterle are dated as the oldest,
BP.

title: History of Clef
text: Clef combinations played a role in the modal system toward the end of the 16th century, and it has been suggested certain clef combinations in the polyphonic music of 16th-century vocal polyphony are reserved for authentic (odd-numbered) modes, and others for plagal (even-numbered) modes,
but the precise implications have been the subject of much scholarly debate.
Reading music as if it were in a different clef from the one indicated can be an aid in
since it will move the pitches roughly in parallel to the written part. Key signatures and accidentals need to be accounted for when this is done.
